content.question: Which of the following functions of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is guaranteed by the Extreme Value Theorem to have an absolute maximum on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 4, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, the inverse tangent of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>tan</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></msup><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator x squared, minus 16, and denominator x squared, plus x, minus 20, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator e raised to the x power, minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, the inverse tangent of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>tan</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></msup><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.2: Extreme Value Theorem, Global Versus Local Extrema, and Critical Points

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
